intro: Lathyrus nevadensis subsp. stipulaceus, commonly known as the Sierra lupine, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is adapted to grow in dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
